articles.title: Arctic Lockdown: COVID-19 Climbs In Canada's Far North - NPR
articles.description: A large and isolated region of northeastern Canada entered a two-week lockdown as coronavirus cases creep up in areas, including largely Indigenous communities, with limited access to intensive care.
articles.content: A man wears a mask as the territory of Nunavut enters a two week mandatory restriction period in Iqaluit, Nunavut, Canada, on Wednesday. More than 80 COVID-19 cases have been identified this month in… [+3124 chars]
